metadata.description:
AMERICANSHITTIES_0239.jpg 
[6000 × 4000]

--------------------------------------------------------

In our life, we’ll spend nearly a year in bathrooms yet we see them as banal. This couldn’t be further from the truth. While living on the street, I became intimately familiar with public bathrooms as places of refuge and reprieve. Years later, I came to appreciate their strange and varied beauty while exploring the US. Bathrooms are curious places gathering relics of use and shits taken. They’re a bundle of contradictions: personal and communal, sacred and irreverent, aesthetic and utilitarian.
